history.proof: intros. unfold is_gcd in *. split. - apply H. - split. + apply H. + intros k H4 H5. apply H. * apply H5. * apply H4.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
r: nat
q: nat
p: nat

Goal:
is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd q p r

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => r div p /\ r div q /\ (forall k : nat, k div p -> k div q -> k div r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Nat.add_le_mono : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n + p <= m + q
Nat.add_lt_mono : forall n m p q : nat, n < m -> p < q -> n + p < m + q
Nat.le_lt_add_lt : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p + m < q + n -> p < q
Nat.mul_lt_mono_nonneg : forall n m p q : nat, 0 <= n -> n < m -> 0 <= p -> p < q -> n * p < m * q
Nat.mul_lt_pred : forall p q n m : nat, S p = q -> p * n < p * m < -> q * n + m < q * m + n
Fin.of_nat_ext : forall h h' : ?p < ?n, Fin.of_nat_lt h = Fin.of_nat_lt h' where ?p : [p : nat q : nat r : nat |- nat] ?n : [p : nat q : nat r : nat |- nat]
Nat.div_lt_upper_bound : forall a b q : nat, b <> 0 -> a < b * q -> a / b < q
Nat.mul_le_mono_nonneg_r : forall n m p : nat, 0 <= p -> n <= m -> n * p <= m * p
Nat.mul_le_mono_nonneg_l : forall n m p : nat, 0 <= p -> n <= m -> p * n <= p * m
Nat.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> m <= p -> n < p
Nat.mul_lt_mono_neg_l : forall p n m : nat, p < 0 -> n < m < -> p * m < p * n
Nat.mul_le_mono_l : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> p * n <= p * m
plus_le_reg_l : forall n m p : nat, p + n <= p + m -> n <= m
Nat.add_le_mono_l : forall n m p : nat, n <= m < -> p + n <= p + m
Nat.add_le_mono_r : forall n m p : nat, n <= m < -> n + p <= m + p
BinPosDef.Pos.succ = fix succ (x : BinNums.positive) : BinNums.positive := match x with | BinNums.xI p => BinNums.xO (succ p) | BinNums.xO p => BinNums.xI p | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xO BinNums.xH end : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.succ _%positive_scope
Fin.of_nat_lt = fix of_nat_lt (p n : nat) {struct p} : p < n -> Fin.t n := match n as n0 return (p < n0 -> Fin.t n0) with | 0 => fun H : p < 0 => False_rect (Fin.t 0) (Nat.nlt_0_r p H) | S n' => match p as p0 return (p0 < S n' -> Fin.t (S n')) with | 0 => fun _ : 0 < S n' => Fin.F1 | S p' => fun H : S p' < S n' => Fin.FS (of_nat_lt p' n' (lt_S_n p' n' H)) end end : forall p n : nat, p < n -> Fin.t n Arguments Fin.of_nat_lt {p n}%nat_scope
Nat.max_assoc : forall m n p : nat, Nat.max m (Nat.max n p) = Nat.max (Nat.max m n) p
Inductive ascii : Set := Ascii : bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> Ascii.ascii Arguments Ascii.Ascii (_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _)%bool_scope
Inductive ZArithProof : Type := DoneProof : ZMicromega.ZArithProof | RatProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | CutProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | EnumProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZWitness -> list ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | ExProof : BinNums.positive -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof Arguments ZMicromega.EnumProof _ _ _%list_scope Arguments ZMicromega.ExProof _%positive_scope
Nat.order_induction_0 : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> A 0 -> (forall n : nat, 0 <= n -> A n -> A (S n)) -> (forall n : nat, n < 0 -> A (S n) -> A n) -> forall n : nat, A n
FinFun.bInjective = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall x y : nat, x < n -> y < n -> f x = f y -> x = y : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bInjective _%nat_scope _%function_scope
nth : forall A : Type, nat -> list A -> A -> A
VarMap.find : forall A : Type, A -> VarMap.t A -> BinNums.positive -> A
Nat.eqf = fun f g : nat -> bool => forall n : nat, f n = g n : (nat -> bool) -> (nat -> bool) -> Prop Arguments Nat.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
RingMicromega.Build_Formula : forall T : Type, EnvRing.PExpr T -> RingMicromega.Op2 -> EnvRing.PExpr T -> RingMicromega.Formula T
Permutation_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), P (y :: x :: l) (x :: y :: l)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> P l l' -> l' ~p l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, l ~p l0 -> P l l0
Nat.induction : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> A 0 -> (forall n : nat, A n -> A (S n)) -> forall n : nat, A n
FinFun.bFun = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall x : nat, x < n -> f x < n : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bFun _%nat_scope _%function_scope
ZifyClasses.mkapp2 : forall (S1 S2 S3 T : Type) (Op : S1 -> S2 -> S3) (I1 : S1 -> T) (I2 : S2 -> T) (I3 : S3 -> T) (TBOP : T -> T -> T), (forall (n : S1) (m : S2), I3 (Op n m) = TBOP (I1 n) (I2 m)) -> forall (s1 : S1) (t1 : T), I1 s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S2) (t2 : T), I2 s2 = t2 -> I3 (Op s1 s2) = TBOP t1 t2
Inductive PExpr (C : Type) : Type := PEc : C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEX : BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEadd : EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEsub : EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEmul : EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEopp : EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEpow : EnvRing.PExpr C -> BinNums.N -> EnvRing.PExpr C Arguments EnvRing.PExpr _%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEc {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEX {C}%type_scope _%positive_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEadd {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEsub {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEmul {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEopp {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEpow {C}%type_scope _ _%N_scope
ZifyClasses.mkrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : S -> T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (I n) (I m)) -> forall (s1 : S) (t1 : T), I s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S) (t2 : T), I s2 = t2 -> R s1 s2 < -> TR t1 t2
Ring_polynom.ring_correct : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi ->...-> req (Ring_polynom.PEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp phi Cp_phi rpow l pe1) (Ring_polynom.PEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp phi Cp_phi rpow l pe2)
FinFun.bSurjective = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall y : nat, y < n -> exists x : nat, x < n /\ f x = y : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bSurjective _%nat_scope _%function_scope
In : forall A : Type, A -> list A -> Prop
ZifyClasses.mkapp : forall (S1 S2 T : Type) (OP : S1 -> S2) (I1 : S1 -> T) (I2 : S2 -> T) (TUOP : T -> T), (forall n : S1, I2 (OP n) = TUOP (I1 n)) -> forall (s1 : S1) (t1 : T), I1 s1 = t1 -> I2 (OP s1) = TUOP t1
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.Cj {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.D {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.N {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.I {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope
firstn : forall A : Type, nat -> list A -> list A
nth_error : forall A : Type, list A -> nat -> option A
FinFun.Injective = fun (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) => forall x y : A, f x = f y -> x = y : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.Injective {A B}%type_scope _%function_scope

```intros.
intros H.
unfold is_gcd in *.
intros [H1 [H2 H3]].
split.
- exact H2.
- split.
  + exact H1.
  + intros k H4 H5.
    apply H3.
    * exact H5.
    * exact H4.```

original: intros. intros H. unfold is_gcd in *. intros [H1 [H2 H3]]. split. - apply H2. - split. + apply H1. + intros k H4 H5. apply H3. * apply H5. * apply H4.
